testCases.explanation: The list [1,2,2,1] reads the same forwards and backwards.
The list [1,2] is not a palindrome since reversed it reads [2,1].
A single node is trivially a palindrome.
The list [1,2,3,2,1] is a palindrome with 3 as the center element.
The list [1,2,3] reversed is [3,2,1], which differs from the original.

description: Given the head of a singly linked list, return true if it is a palindrome, or false otherwise. An efficient solution runs in O(n) time and O(1) space by reversing the second half and comparing.
constraints: The number of nodes in the list is in the range [1, 10^5]
